Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2014 01:33PM raysofsunshine07 wrote: Warrior Woman:  Yes, I have read many of your posts and I noticed too that many of our information is the same!!!  I too am really nervous about the oncotype results....but I just try to take each step as it comes!!  I feel blessed that so far everything has gone in my favor and I expect that to continue!!!  What are your thoughts on chemo?  I am totally amazed by your 3 mile jog.  Great job!!! Piano Girl:  Before my surgery - we went and bought a recliner.  I tell ya - it has made sleeping very easy!!!  It seems as though my two young boys and hubby love it too!!  At this point I can't really imagine sleeping in the bed.  The fact that I can't roll over I think has saved me some pain.....and I have had great deep healing sleep.  I would highly recommend it!! What are you girls wearing for support while you are getting filled?  A cami with built in support seems to be working great for me.  I  heard that sports bras are a great option.  I tried that....and discovered that I got stuck in it trying to get it off!!!  Thank goodness I had help to get out of it!!!
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2014 07:47PM raysofsunshine07 wrote: Warrior:  Can you tell me more about the "cold caps"?  What they found on my mammogram were two different spots....then I had my MRI prior to surgery and they found another "suspicious area" in the same breast that did not show up on the mammogram.  There is a high probability it is cancerous.  I will find out how much cancer total was in my right breast at my oncologist appointment when we go over pathology.  My oncologist told me prior to surgery that with the combination of all these areas she would most likely recommend chemo for me.  They would exceed the 2cm.  She asked me to be prepared for that possibility....which I have.  My infusions would be 4 total.....1 every 3 weeks.  I would also be on the hormone meds. Back in 2008 I had breast reduction surgery and I was pretty happy with my breast after that.  I often wonder if messing around in my chest back in 2008 had something to do with the cancer showing up.  What are your opinions on this?
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2014 11:59AM raysofsunshine07 wrote: Happy New Year!!!!  I am a little late posting to the December 2013 surgeries....but better late than never!!  I have been learning how to cruise the website and have really learned a lot reading all your posts.  I had my surgery 12/4/13....double mastectomy with expanders.  I had a small fill in surgery and have been healing nicely so far.  I start PT 1/13/14.  I had my second fill last Friday (50cc each) and have another tomorrow.  I think the 50cc was a good amount....I was a bit uncomfortable for a day....but it was manageable!!  I have my follow-up with the surgeon on 1/9/14 and don't have my follow-up scheduled for my oncologist yet.  I will find out my oncotype score then.  I am ER+ and HER2-.  My sentinal node came back neg for cancer.  It's very exciting.....yesterday was my first time driving for 3 weeks!!  Yesterday was my first day without pain pills...yay!!!!!!  I usually take something before I get filled though.....  I look forward to posting more to this site....all of you are such an inspiration!!!!
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2014 09:08PM raysofsunshine07 wrote: Sandra:  I completely agree.   Doesn't help things to speculate too much....but sometimes our mind takes us there!!!
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611
